intro: Hieracium murorum f. vulgatum, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, rough stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are usually alternate, with a serrated margin and a rough texture. It is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
